name: Baymont Inn & Suites Universal Studios

reviews.title: Stay at the LQ next door instead!
reviews.text: Stay at the La Quinta next door instead - it is much nicer! We usually stay at the LQ but decided to try Baymont because of crazy cheap rate - big mistake. The room had a funny smell, the bedding was terrible - gross bedspread that looked 15 years old, sheets too small and kept coming off, and the bathroom was gross. Again, I'm all about budget hotels but this one was just beyond my comfort level. Again, stay next door instead!

First time I've been to Orlando so didn't know what to expect. Baymont Inn was clean, comfortable and the breakfasts were satisfying. Hotel staff were helpful and courteous. I lost my reading glasses but they were found and returned safely to me. There was a microwave and fridge in the room so you didn't have to go hungry in the middle of the night. Buy goodies from Walgreens and stash them in the fridge just in case. Heat in microwave for a hot meal.
reviews.title: The Sunshine State

likes.disliked: — The dust around the edges of the room and hallway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a Walgreens about 10 mins walk away. In the other direction is an Indian restaurant called Tabla - $7 for lunch buffets ($10 on Sundays). Very nice.
reviews.title: Good hotel for Universal Studios

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outside is the Green Trolley Bus that takes you to International Drive or can transfer to Red Trolley Bus. Also is the Link Bus 21 to Downtown Orlando in one direction or Universal Studios in the other. Baymont Inn has a shuttle that leaves at 9.30 am to Universal Studios, picking up at 6 pm. Buy 7 day passes from certain outlets only. Having said that, works for you if you're travelling on your own as Florida is more geared toward hiring of cars.
reviews.title: Basic, Clean Hotel and Pleasant Staff

likes.liked: — Clean room/ nice location to Universal.
likes.disliked: — Breakfast, but I'm not big on that stuff anyhow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Take the Mears Shttle Bus from Orlando International Airport to Baymont Inn for $28 return. Better than trying to get on Trolley Buses with your suitcases.
reviews.title: Try it out!!

likes.liked: — The staff including the managers on duty were great

reviews.text: This is a basic hotel, and a deal for the location. There weren't any extras, but the beds were comfortable and the hotel clean. It was a five minute drive into the Universal Resort, which was the reason we went.
reviews.title: No frills but clean and comfy.

reviews.text: The breakfast area was a little cramped, but could be dealt with by avoiding rush times.
reviews.title: BOTTOM-END Budget Hotel

likes.disliked: — The hotel itself!! Wouldn't stay there again.

aka: Baymont Inn And Suites Universal Studios
